title: Understanding impact of price change on demand
text:
Price elasticity of demand is the ratio of the percentage change in quantity demanded of a product to the percentage change in price.


\(Price Elasticity = (d(Quantity)/Quantity)) / (d(Price)/Price))\)




Performed regression analysis to understand the relationship between price and demand within category.

title: Understanding impact of price change on demand
text:
Regression Overview
Regression analysis is a set of statistical methods used for the estimation of relationships between a dependent variable and one or more independent variables. It can be utilized to assess the strength of the relationship between variables and for modeling the future relationship between them.

Equation:


\(Y = a + b*x1 + c*x2 + d*x3 + ... + e\)

Where: Y – Dependent (target) variable
x1, x2, x3 – Independent (explanatory) variables a – Intercept b, c, d – Slopes e – Residual (error)

Interpretation: one unit change in variable x1 will impact Y by the factor of b, keeping all the values as it is


Equation for our case:
Regression models will be build on category level to understand the interaction of prices changes within category

\(Category Demand = const+coef_1*Price_{subcat1}+coef_2*Price_{subcat2}+coef_3*Price_{subcat3}+...+e\)

title: Analysis
text:
Data contains historical sales (2015 to 2018) of products in supermart. These products are categorized in 7 category:


Bakery


Beverages


Eggs, Meat and Fish


Food Grains


Fruits and Veggies


Oil and Masala


Snacks

Derive Price from Sales and Quantity: \(Price=Sales/Quantity\)

df['Price']=df['Sales']/df['Quantity']

Add Week, Month, Year and YearMonth to dataframe

# Add week, month, year and yearmonth column
df['Week']=df['Order Date'].dt.isocalendar().week
df['Month']=df['Order Date'].dt.month
df['Year']=df['Order Date'].dt.isocalendar().year
df['YearMonth']=df['Order Date'].dt.strftime('%Y-%m')

title: Analysis
text:
Sales Pattern Analysis

Overall Level

There is yearly seasonal pattern observed and upward trend




                                                





                                                



Time Series Decomposition

Time series data has 3 components, trend, seasonal and residual

Trend Component: There is upward trend present in the data





Seasonal Component: There is yearly seasonality present in the data






There is no pattern observed between Price and Quantity at overall level




                                                





Category Level


Total quantiy sold: 196173



All cateogries are contributing to ~15% of the total sales




                                                



Category sales wrt year month

Oil and Masala has reduced in 2018 Q4 is performing better than rest of the quarters for all categories Fruits & Veggies sales reduced from 2016 to 2017




                                                




Include Trend and Seasonal indicator

Trend is added by assigning 1 to first date and then incrementing it by 1 Seasonality is added by including month number

Snacks, Bakery and Food Grains are highly correlated
